{{MedalCountry|{{fb|ESP}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[UEFA European U-19 Championship]]}} {{Medal|W|[[2012 UEFA European U-19 Championship|2012 Estonia]]|}} }} '''Kepa Arrizabalaga Revuelta''' ({{IPA-eu|kepa aris̻aβalaɣa reβuelta|lang}}; {{IPA-es|ˈkepa ariθaβaˈlaɣa reˈβwelta|lang}}; born 3 October 1994) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]]. He is sometimes referred to mononomously by his forename.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/en/convocados/kepa-arrizabalaga|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga|publisher=[[Royal Spanish Football Federation]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190226000752/http://www.sefutbol.com/en/convocados/kepa-arrizabalaga|archive-date=26 February 2019|dead-url=no|accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
Developed at [[Athletic Bilbao]], he played his first professional games on loan at [[SD Ponferradina|Ponferradina]] and [[Real Valladolid]], in [[Segunda División]]. He then returned to his first club, going on to appear in 54 matches across all competitions; in 2018, he signed with Chelsea.
Arrizabalaga won the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2012 European Championship]] with [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain's under-19 team]] and made his [[Spain national football team|senior]] debut in 2017, being selected for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Athletic Bilbao=== Born in [[Ondarroa]], [[Biscay]], Basque Country, Arrizabalaga joined [[Athletic Bilbao]]'s youth setup at [[Lezama Facilities|Lezama]] in 2004, aged ten. He made his senior debut with [[CD Basconia|the farm team]] in January 2012, in [[Tercera División]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-chelsea-ficha-kepa-portero-mas-caro-historia-20180808231338.html|title=El Chelsea ficha a Kepa, el portero más caro de la historia|trans-title=Chelsea sign Kepa, most expensive goalkeeper in history|publisher=[[Europa Press (news agency)|Europa Press]]|language=es|date=8 August 2018|accessdate=9 January 2019}}</ref>
On 5 May 2012, Arrizabalaga was called up to the main squad for a [[La Liga]] match against [[Getafe CF]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.athletic-club.net/web/main.asp?a=0&b=1&c=2&d=1000&berria=12069&idi=2|title=Athletic Club-Getafe: Line-ups|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|date=5 May 2012|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> but remained unused in the 0–0 draw at the [[San Mamés Stadium (1913)|San Mamés Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/marcador/futbol/2011_12/primera/jornada_37/ath_get/|title=Sin argumentos en la Catedral|trans-title=No arguments at the Cathedral|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=Álvaro|last=Sánchez|language=es|date=5 May 2012|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> He was also called up to pre-season in July, and on 23 September was also a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in another home game of the same outcome, against [[Málaga CF]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2012_13/primera/jornada_5/ath_mga/|title=Europa les pesa|trans-title=Europe weighs on them|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|first=Ángel|last=Liceras|language=es|date=23 September 2012|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref>
Arrizabalaga was promoted to [[Bilbao Athletic|the reserves]] in January 2013, to cover for injured [[Jon Ander Serantes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bizkaia.eldesmarque.com/athletic-club/33979-en-lezama-apuestan-fuerte-por-kepa-arrizabalaba|title=En Lezama apuestan fuerte por Kepa Arrizabalaga|trans-title=Lezama bets high on Kepa Arrizabalaga|publisher=El Desmarque|language=es|date=9 January 2013|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> He made his debut for the B-side on 16 February 2013, keeping a [[Shutout|clean sheet]] in a 1–0 win over [[UD Logroñés]] for the [[Segunda División B]] championship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uniondeportivalogroñes.com/index.php/8-destacados/131-bilbao-athletic-1-0-union-deportiva-logrones|title=Bilbao Athletic 1–0 Unión Deportiva Logroñés|publisher=UD Logroñés|language=es|date=16 February 2013|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> On 3 March, he was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] towards the end of a 3–1 home win over [[SD Amorebieta]], as was teammate [[Jon García Herrero|Jon García]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bizkaia.eldesmarque.com/athletic-club/noticias/34732-el-bilbao-athletic-amenaza-el-liderato-del-alaves|title=El Bilbao Athletic amenaza el liderato del Alavés|trans-title=Bilbao Athletic threaten Alavés' lead|publisher=El Desmarque|language=es|date=4 March 2013|accessdate=29 November 2015}}</ref> in April he suffered a [[Athletic pubalgia|pubalgia]], only returning to the fields in September.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bizkaia.eldesmarque.com/athletic-club/37480-Kepa-Arrizabalaga-reaparece-casi-seis-meses-despu%C3%A9s-en-el-Bilbao-Athletic|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga reaparece casi seis meses después en el Bilbao Athletic|trans-title=Kepa Arrizabalaga reappears after nearly six months in Bilbao Athletic|publisher=El Desmarque|first=Javi|last=Beltrán|language=es|date=29 September 2013|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref>
Arrizabalaga appeared regularly for the B's after his return, but broke the first [[metacarpal]] of his right hand in January 2014,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.athletic-club.net/web/main.asp?a=0&b=1&c=2&d=1000&berria=13915&idi=2|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga's injury|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|date=22 January 2014|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> being sidelined for a month. On 11 March, Getafe submitted a loan request to the ''Lions'' for him, as a replacement to injured [[Miguel Ángel Moyá]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aupaathletic.com/noticias/noticias-ver.asp?id=11023|title=El Getafe pide la cesión de Kepa Arrizabalaga|trans-title=Getafe ask for Kepa Arrizabalaga's loan|publisher=Aupa Athletic|language=es|date=11 March 2014|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> but it was rejected a day later.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://athletic.elcorreo.com/noticias/2014-03-12/athletic-rechaza-ceder-hasta-20140312.html|title=El Athletic rechaza ceder hasta final de Liga al portero Kepa al Getafe|trans-title=Athletic reject loaning goalkeeper Kepa to Getafe until the end of the League|newspaper=[[El Correo]]|first=Javier|last=Ortiz de Lazcano|language=es|date=12 March 2014|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref>
On 5 January 2015, Arrizabalaga was loaned to [[Segunda División]]'s [[SD Ponferradina]] until June.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sdponferradina.com/-/mi|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga se incorpora a la Ponferradina|trans-title=Kepa Arrizabalaga added to Ponferradina|publisher=SD Ponferradina|language=es|date=5 January 2015|accessdate=5 January 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150109172714/http://www.sdponferradina.com/-/mi|archivedate=9 January 2015|df=}}</ref> He made his professional debut on the 11th, starting in a 1–1 home draw against [[Racing de Santander]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2015/01/11/futbol/2adivision/1421014655.html|title=El Racing encontró justo premio a su trabajo en el último minuto|trans-title=Racing's work paid off in the last minute|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|language=es|date=11 January 2015|accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref>
On 20 July 2015, Arrizabalaga moved to [[Real Valladolid]] also in the second tier, in a [[2015–16 Segunda División|season]]-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realvalladolid.es/noticias/actualidad/20072015/Kepa-cierra-la-porteria-del-Pucela/|title=Kepa cierra la portería del Pucela|trans-title=Kepa shuts down goal of Pucela|publisher=Real Valladolid|language=es|date=20 July 2015|accessdate=20 July 2015}}</ref> He played his first competitive game on 22 August, in a 0–1 loss at [[Córdoba CF]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2015/08/23/futbol/equipos/cordoba/1440284201.html|title=Fidel resuelve en un gran partido del Córdoba|trans-title=Fidel the decider in a great Córdoba match|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|first=Alberto|last=Laz|language=es|date=23 August 2015|accessdate=7 September 2015}}</ref> and missed only three matches as his team finished 16th.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.diariodevalladolid.es/noticias/deportes/kepa-traera-dinero-zorrilla_125966.html|title=Kepa traerá dinero a Zorrilla|trans-title=Kepa will bring money to Zorrilla|newspaper=Diario de Valladolid|language=es|date=8 August 2018|accessdate=9 January 2019}}</ref>
After returning from loan, Arrizabalaga was definitely included in the first team, initially as third-choice behind [[Gorka Iraizoz]] and [[Iago Herrerín]]. He made his debut in the top flight on 11 September 2016, starting in a 1–0 away win over [[Deportivo de La Coruña]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2016_17/la-liga/jornada_3/dep_ath/|title=Raúl García exhibe su pegada|trans-title=Raúl García shows his power|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|first=Jaime|last=Rincón|language=es|date=11 September 2016|accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref>
On 22 January 2018, amid heavy transfer speculation linking him to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], Arrizabalaga renewed his contract – due to expire that June – until 2025.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11848/11218301/kepa-arrizabalaga-ends-real-madrid-speculation-by-signing-athletic-bilbao-deal|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga ends Real Madrid speculation by signing Athletic Bilbao deal|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=22 January 2018|accessdate=23 January 2018}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[File:Chelsea 3 Arsenal 2 (43443195334).jpg|thumb|left|Arrizabalaga playing for Chelsea in a match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2018]] On 8 August 2018, Athletic Bilbao announced on their website that Arrizabalaga had paid his required [[release clause]] (€80 million / £71.6 million),<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.athletic-club.eus/en/noticias/19263/kepa-pays-termination-clause.html|title=Kepa pays termination clause|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|date=8 August 2018|accessdate=8 August 2018}}</ref> making him the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|world's most expensive goalkeeper]] only weeks after the record was set by [[Alisson (footballer, born 1992)|Alisson]]'s transfer to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/07/chelsea-kepa-arrizabalaga-athletic-bilbao-record|title=Chelsea to pay £71.6m for Athletic Bilbao goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Dominic|last=Fifield|date=7 August 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> Later that day, his move to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on a seven-year contract was confirmed,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/8/8/kepa-arrives-at-chelsea|title=Kepa arrives at Chelsea|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|date=8 August 2018|accessdate=8 August 2018}}</ref> replacing [[Thibaut Courtois]] who departed for [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]] and he made his [[Premier League]] debut three days later in a 3–0 away win against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]];<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45067371|title=Huddersfield Town 0–3 Chelsea|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Michael|last=Emons|date=11 August 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> he went on to keep six clean sheets<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/chelseas-kepa-relishing-being-worlds-most-expensive-keeper/ph9py6s9dsx616jcv411ad0jq|title=Chelsea's Kepa relishing being world's most expensive keeper|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|date=10 October 2018|accessdate=9 January 2019}}</ref> in the team's 12-match unbeaten run in the league, before a 3–1 defeat at the hands of [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/tottenham-vs-chelsea/390883|title=Tottenham 3–1 Chelsea: Maurizio Sarri's unbeaten start ended|publisher=Sky Sports|first=Ron|last=Walker|date=24 November 2018|accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>
On 24 January 2019, in the second leg of the [[EFL Cup]] semi-final, Arrizabalaga saved a [[Penalty (association football)|penalty]] from Tottenham's [[Lucas Moura]] in a 4–2 [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|shootout]] win at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], helping his team go through to the [[2019 EFL Cup Final|final]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sportinglife.com/football/news/chelsea-make-spurs-pay-the-penalty/157724|title=Carabao Cup semi-final: Chelsea beat Tottenham 4–2 on penalties to book final clash with Manchester City at Wembley|newspaper=[[Sporting Life (British newspaper)|Sporting Life]]|date=24 January 2019|accessdate=24 January 2019}}</ref>
On 24 February 2019, during the [[2019 EFL Cup Final]] against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], with the match at 0–0 near the end of extra time, [[Maurizio Sarri]] called for Arrizabalaga to be substituted off for [[Willy Caballero]] for the upcoming penalty shootout; Sarri was concerned over his leg cramping a few minutes prior after making a diving save. However, Arrizabalaga refused to be substituted, gesticulating and remaining on the field. During the shootout, he saved one penalty as Chelsea lost the shoot-out 4–3.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Burt |first1=Jason |last2=Tyers |first2=Mike |title=Manchester City take the honours after Kepa Arrizabalaga antics overshadow otherwise drab League Cup final |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/02/24/chelsea-vs-manchester-city-carabao-cup-final-2019-live-score/ |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=25 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=WATCH: Kepa Arrizabalaga defies furious Chelsea boss Maurizio Sarri in Carabao Cup final |url=https://news.sky.com/story/watch-kepa-arrizabalaga-defies-furious-chelsea-boss-maurizio-sarri-in-carabao-cup-final-11647428 |publisher=[[Sky News]] |accessdate=25 February 2019}}</ref> After the game, both Arrizabalaga and Sarri said that the situation was a misunderstanding, with Sarri incorrectly believing that Arrizabalaga was too injured with a cramp to continue.<ref>{{cite web |title=Maurizio Sarri: Kepa Arrizabalaga incident a 'misunderstanding', says Chelsea boss |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47352319 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 February 2019}}</ref> Later on, Arrizabalaga met with Sarri and apologised to him and to the rest of the club. He was fined a week's worth of pay as a result of his actions, with Sarri leaving the decision of any further discipline up to the club, due to the club rules.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47365945 |title=Kepa Arrizabalaga: Chelsea goalkeeper fined & apologises for Wembley incident |date=25 February 2019 |website=[[BBC Sport]] |access-date=26 February 2019}}</ref> Kepa was dropped from the starting lineup for Caballero in Chelsea's next match, a Premier League game against Tottenham.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/its-a-message-to-the-group-sarri-explains-reasoning-for-dropping-/fei9ryhrddhg13xh86pt31i0v|title='It's a message to the group' - Sarri explains reasoning for dropping Kepa|publisher=Goal.com|date=28 February 2019|accessdate=1 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Kepa Arrizabalaga (6) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Arrizabalaga with [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] in 2012]] After appearing for [[Spain national under-18 football team|Spain's under-18s]], Arrizabalaga was called up to [[Spain national under-19 football team|the under-19 team]] for [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|that year]]'s [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship|UEFA European Championship]]. He was an undisputed starter during the tournament, as his side were crowned champions;<ref name="U19">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/history/season=2012/|title=Spain make it six of the best in Estonia|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=10 December 2014}}</ref> highlights included a 3–3 semi-final success against [[France national under-19 football team|France]], where he saved two penalties in the shootout.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1840396.html|title=Spain finally see off France in semi-final shoot-out|publisher=UEFA|date=12 July 2012|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref>
Arrizabalaga missed the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] due to injury, being replaced in the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup squads#Spain|tournament squad]] by [[Rubén Yáñez]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/kepa-arrizabalaga-deja-concentracion-lesion-y-se-perdera-mundial-turquia|title=Kepa deja la concentración por lesión y se pierde el Mundial de Turquía|trans-title=Kepa leaves training camp due to injury and misses World Cup in Turkey|publisher=Royal Spanish Football Federation|language=es|date=7 June 2013|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref> On 8 November 2013 he was called up to the [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 team]], along with Athletic teammate [[Iker Muniain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.athletic-club.net/web/main.asp?a=0&b=1&c=2&d=1000&berria=13702&idi=2|title=Under21 Call-up|publisher=Athletic Bilbao|date=8 November 2013|accessdate=11 December 2014}}</ref>
Arrizabalaga was called up to the [[Spain national football team|senior side]] on 22 March 2017 ahead of a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifier]] against [[Israel national football team|Israel]] and a [[Exhibition game|friendly]] with [[France national football team|France]], as a late replacement for the injured [[Pepe Reina]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.india.com/sports/kepa-arrizabalaga-gets-spain-call-as-pepe-reina-suffers-injury-1950330/|title=Kepa Arrizabalaga gets Spain call as Pepe Reina suffers injury|publisher=India.com|date=22 March 2017|accessdate=23 March 2017}}</ref> He earned his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] on 11 November of that year, playing the full 90 minutes in a 5–0 friendly win over [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] in [[Málaga]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/90minutes/ct-hoy-silva-nets-brace-spain-thrash-costa-rica-in-friendly-20171111-story.html|title=Silva nets brace, Spain thrash Costa Rica in friendly|newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=11 November 2017|accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/en/match-report-spain-thrash-costa-rica-malaga-5-0-0|title=Match report: Spain thrash Costa Rica in Málaga (5–0)|publisher=Royal Spanish Football Federation|date=11 November 2017|accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
Arrizabalaga was named in Spain's [[2018 FIFA World Cup squads#Spain|23-man squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/morata-misses-out-on-spain-world-cup-squad/1ub1qz7jod09i1lfvdcy84ea2l|title=Morata misses out on Spain's 23-man World Cup squad|publisher=Goal|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
